intro: Lavandula dentata f. rosea, commonly known as the rose-scented lavender, is a fragrant flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a hybrid form of Lavandula dentata, characterized by its soft pink to lavender-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features silvery-gray, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and herbal use. Its aromatic properties make it valuable in both ornamental gardening and traditional medicine.
